tools.name: PhyloSD
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenomic Subgenome Detection pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed for the detection of subgenomes in allopolyploids using phylogenomic data, helping to disentangle complex evolutionary histories in polyploid organisms.

tools.name: PhySigs
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic inference of mutational signature exposures
tools.detailed_description: A method for inferring the exposures of mutational signatures along the branches of a phylogenetic tree, enabling the study of how mutational processes change over evolutionary time.

tools.name: modeltest_phylo
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for phylogenetic model selection and reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: A shell-based pipeline that integrates model selection tools (jModelTest, ProtTest) with phylogenetic reconstruction software (PhyML, RAxML) and topology comparison (CONSEL) to streamline phylogenetic analysis.

tools.name: BDEI
tools.one_line_profile: Inference of BDEI epidemiological model parameters from trees
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for inferring the parameters of a Birth-Death Exposed-Infectious (BDEI) model directly from phylogenetic trees, linking phylodynamics with epidemiological modeling.

tools.name: fasttrees
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and frugal tree classifier for sklearn
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of 'fast and frugal trees' (simple decision trees) compatible with scikit-learn. While a general ML tool, it implements a specific cognitive/statistical model used in decision science and data analysis.

tools.name: HomBlocks
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for organelle phylogenomics alignment
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for constructing multiple alignments for organelle phylogenomics. It identifies locally collinear blocks to handle rearrangements and creates datasets for phylogenetic inference.

tools.name: contraband
tools.one_line_profile: BEAST2 package for continuous trait evolution
tools.detailed_description: A BEAST2 package that implements Brownian motion models for the study of continuous trait evolution on phylogenetic trees, allowing for the integration of phenotypic data with molecular phylogenetics.

tools.name: TreeSort
tools.one_line_profile: Virus reassortment inference software using molecular clock constraints
tools.detailed_description: TreeSort is a software tool designed for inferring both recent and ancestral virus reassortment events. It utilizes flexible molecular clock constraints to analyze phylogenetic discrepancies, aiding in the understanding of viral evolution and reassortment dynamics.

tools.name: rf-net-2
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic network inference for reassortment detection
tools.detailed_description: rf-net-2 is a tool for inferring phylogenetic networks specifically to detect reassortment events. It is designed to work with viral genomic data to reconstruct evolutionary histories involving reticulate events.

tools.name: pairdist
tools.one_line_profile: Neighbor-joining tree construction from pairwise ML distances
tools.detailed_description: pairdist is a utility that creates a neighbor-joining phylogenetic tree from a set of sequences. It calculates maximum likelihood distances based on pairwise sequence alignments to construct the tree.

tools.name: TeddyPi
tools.one_line_profile: Transposable Element detection and discovery for Phylogenetic inference
tools.detailed_description: TeddyPi (Transposable Element detection and discovery for Phylogenetic inference) is a pipeline designed to leverage transposable element data for phylogenetic reconstruction, offering an alternative or complementary marker system to standard sequence data.

tools.name: IQ-TREE 2
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient software for phylogenomic inference using maximum likelihood
tools.detailed_description: IQ-TREE 2 is a widely used software for efficient phylogenomic inference. It implements maximum likelihood methods for tree reconstruction, model selection (ModelFinder), and tree validation (Ultrafast Bootstrap), handling large datasets with high performance.

tools.name: IQ-TREE 3
tools.one_line_profile: Next-generation version of the IQ-TREE phylogenetic software
tools.detailed_description: IQ-TREE 3 is the development version of the IQ-TREE software suite, continuing the focus on fast and accurate maximum likelihood phylogenetic inference with new features and optimizations.

tools.name: piqtree
tools.one_line_profile: Python library interface for IQ-TREE functionalities
tools.detailed_description: piqtree is a Python library that exposes the core features of IQ-TREE, allowing developers and researchers to integrate efficient phylogenomic inference capabilities directly into Python-based workflows and tools.

tools.name: orthogarden
tools.one_line_profile: ML phylogenetic inference for non-model organisms
tools.detailed_description: orthogarden is a machine learning-based tool for phylogenetic inference, specifically tailored for non-model organisms using short reads and assemblies. It aims to facilitate phylogenomics in species with limited genomic resources.

tools.name: BUSCO_phylogenomics
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline to construct species phylogenies using BUSCO proteins
tools.detailed_description: BUSCO_phylogenomics is a utility script and pipeline that automates the construction of species phylogenies by extracting and aligning BUSCO (Benchmarking Universal Single-Copy Orthologs) proteins from genomic data.

tools.name: which_tree
tools.one_line_profile: Testing framework for phylogenetic inference methods
tools.detailed_description: which_tree is a tool designed for testing and comparing different phylogenetic inference methods. It helps researchers evaluate the performance and accuracy of various tree-building algorithms.

tools.name: vbsky
tools.one_line_profile: Variational Bayesian skyline for inferring evolutionary models
tools.detailed_description: vbsky implements a Variational Bayesian skyline approach to infer evolutionary models and population history from large phylogenetic datasets, offering a computationally efficient alternative to standard MCMC methods.

tools.name: orthoscope
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic tool for phylogenetic inference of orthogroups
tools.detailed_description: Orthoscope is an automatic tool (often deployed as a web service) for the phylogenetic inference of animal and plant orthogroups, designed to handle purposeful taxonomic sampling for evolutionary studies.

tools.name: quicktree
tools.one_line_profile: Fast implementation of the neighbor-joining algorithm
tools.detailed_description: QuickTree is a highly efficient implementation of the Neighbor-Joining algorithm for phylogenetic tree reconstruction, capable of handling large sets of sequences rapidly.

tools.name: AMPHORA
tools.one_line_profile: Automated Phylogenomic Inference Pipeline
tools.detailed_description: AMPHORA is an automated pipeline for phylogenomic inference that uses protein marker genes to assign phylogenetic taxonomy to metagenomic sequence data.

tools.name: bdskytools
tools.one_line_profile: R functions for Birth-Death Skyline (BDSKY) analysis in BEAST2
tools.detailed_description: bdskytools is an R package providing functions to read, process, and plot the results of Birth-Death Skyline (BDSKY) analyses run in BEAST2, facilitating the interpretation of epidemiological and evolutionary dynamics.

tools.name: beastio
tools.one_line_profile: R package for pre- and post-processing of BEAST files
tools.detailed_description: beastio is an R package designed to assist with the input and output processing for BEAST and BEAST2 software, helping users manage configuration files and analyze output logs.

tools.name: nidhoggr
tools.one_line_profile: Snakemake pipeline for phylogenetic tree inference
tools.detailed_description: nidhoggr is a Snakemake-based pipeline that automates the process of phylogenetic tree inference, managing steps from alignment to tree building to ensure reproducibility and scalability.

tools.name: PhyloHerb
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenomic analysis pipeline for Herbarium specimens
tools.detailed_description: PhyloHerb is a phylogenomic analysis pipeline specifically optimized for processing data from herbarium specimens, addressing challenges associated with degraded DNA and historical samples.

tools.name: NetRAX
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic Network Inference without ILS
tools.detailed_description: NetRAX is a C++ tool for inferring phylogenetic networks. It focuses on scenarios without Incomplete Lineage Sorting (ILS), providing methods for reconstructing reticulate evolutionary histories.

tools.name: evolnets
tools.one_line_profile: R package to reconstruct ancestral networks from RevBayes output
tools.detailed_description: evolnets is an R package designed to process output from RevBayes, specifically for reconstructing and visualizing ancestral networks inferred during Bayesian phylogenetic analysis.

tools.name: GCtree
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic inference of genotype-collapsed trees
tools.detailed_description: GCtree is a tool for the phylogenetic inference of genotype-collapsed trees, often used in B-cell receptor lineage analysis to handle identical sequences and abundance data.

tools.name: linearham
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian Phylo-HMM for B cell receptor sequence analysis
tools.detailed_description: linearham is a Bayesian Phylogenetic Hidden Markov Model (Phylo-HMM) tool designed for the analysis of B cell receptor (BCR) sequences, integrating VDJ recombination and somatic hypermutation models.

tools.name: Phyla
tools.one_line_profile: Foundation Model for Phylogenetic Inference
tools.detailed_description: Phyla is an AI-based foundation model designed for phylogenetic inference. It leverages deep learning techniques to learn evolutionary patterns and assist in constructing phylogenetic trees.

tools.name: FastTree 2
tools.one_line_profile: Approximately-Maximum-Likelihood Trees for Large Alignments
tools.detailed_description: FastTree 2 is a standard tool for inferring approximately-maximum-likelihood phylogenetic trees from very large alignments. It is known for its speed and scalability compared to traditional ML methods.

tools.name: FastDTLmapper
tools.one_line_profile: Genome-wide gene gain/loss mapping using DTL reconciliation
tools.detailed_description: FastDTLmapper is a tool for mapping gene gain and loss events across a genome using the Duplication-Transfer-Loss (DTL) reconciliation method, aiding in the study of gene family evolution.

tools.name: beagle_optimiser
tools.one_line_profile: Optimizer for BEAST/MrBayes BEAGLE library settings
tools.detailed_description: beagle_optimiser is a utility that benchmarks different BEAGLE library configurations for a given BEAST or MrBayes input file to determine the settings that yield the shortest analysis time.

tools.name: TreeTime
tools.one_line_profile: Maximum likelihood inference of time stamped phylogenies
tools.detailed_description: TreeTime is a tool for maximum likelihood inference of time-stamped phylogenies and ancestral reconstruction. It is widely used for viral evolution analysis to estimate molecular clocks and date ancestral nodes.

tools.name: CoalRe
tools.one_line_profile: BEAST2 implementation of the coalescent with reassortment
tools.detailed_description: CoalRe is a package for the BEAST2 software that implements a coalescent model incorporating reassortment, allowing for the inference of evolutionary parameters in segmented viruses.

tools.name: CoupledMCMC
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive parallel tempering for BEAST2
tools.detailed_description: CoupledMCMC is a BEAST2 package that implements adaptive parallel tempering (MC3), improving the mixing and convergence of MCMC chains for complex phylogenetic models.

tools.name: Mascot
tools.one_line_profile: Structured coalescent approximation for BEAST2
tools.detailed_description: Mascot is a BEAST2 package that implements an approximation of the structured coalescent (Marginal Approximation of the Structured COalescenT), enabling efficient inference of migration rates and population dynamics.

tools.name: Recombination
tools.one_line_profile: BEAST2 package to model recombination
tools.detailed_description: Recombination is a package for BEAST2 designed to model recombination events within the phylogenetic framework, extending the capabilities of standard coalescent analysis.

tools.name: BEASTmasteR
tools.one_line_profile: R code for generating BEAST2 XML configuration files
tools.detailed_description: BEASTmasteR is an R tool for programmatically generating complex XML input files for BEAST2, with a focus on morphology and tip-dating analyses which are difficult to configure manually.

tools.name: BioGeoBEARS
tools.one_line_profile: BioGeography with Bayesian and likelihood Evolutionary Analysis
tools.detailed_description: BioGeoBEARS is an R package for performing historical biogeography analysis. It allows for probabilistic inference of ancestral ranges on a phylogeny using various models (DEC, DIVA, BAYAREA).

tools.name: Burntrees
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts for manipulating phylogenetic MCMC output
tools.detailed_description: Burntrees is a collection of Perl scripts for processing and manipulating the output trees from phylogenetic MCMC software like MrBayes and BEAST, facilitating burn-in removal and tree summarization.

tools.name: catfasta2phyml
tools.one_line_profile: Concatenates FASTA files to PHYLIP format
tools.detailed_description: catfasta2phyml is a utility script that concatenates multiple FASTA formatted sequence files into a single PHYLIP formatted alignment file, a common preprocessing step for phylogenetic software like PhyML.

tools.name: snvphyl-galaxy
tools.one_line_profile: Galaxy wrapper for SNVPhyl phylogenomics pipeline
tools.detailed_description: snvphyl-galaxy provides the Galaxy tool wrappers for the SNVPhyl pipeline, enabling users to run whole-genome single nucleotide variant (SNV) phylogenomics analyses within the Galaxy platform interface.

tools.name: snvphyl-tools
tools.one_line_profile: Core tools for the SNVPhyl phylogenomics pipeline
tools.detailed_description: snvphyl-tools contains the underlying scripts and utilities used by the SNVPhyl pipeline for tasks such as variant calling, alignment generation, and tree building from whole-genome sequencing data.

tools.name: bito
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance library for Bayesian phylogenetics via optimization
tools.detailed_description: bito is a C++ library with a Python interface designed for high-performance gradient-based optimization in Bayesian phylogenetics. It serves as a computational engine for inferring tree structures and evolutionary parameters.

tools.name: Orthoflow
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for phylogenetic inference of genome-scale datasets
tools.detailed_description: Orthoflow is a workflow designed for phylogenetic inference using genome-scale datasets of protein-coding genes. It orchestrates the process of orthology inference, alignment, and tree building.

tools.name: splace
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to split, align and concatenate gene sequences for phylogenetics
tools.detailed_description: Splace is a utility tool designed to prepare datasets for phylogenetic inference by splitting, aligning, and concatenating gene sequences.

tools.name: phylociraptor
tools.one_line_profile: Rapid and customizable phylogenomic tree calculation framework
tools.detailed_description: Phylociraptor is a highly customizable framework for reproducible phylogenomic inference, designed to streamline the calculation of phylogenetic trees from genomic data.

tools.name: RevGadgets
tools.one_line_profile: Postprocessing tools for RevBayes output
tools.detailed_description: RevGadgets is an R package containing tools for processing and visualizing the output generated by the Bayesian phylogenetic inference software RevBayes.

tools.name: RevGadgets_old
tools.one_line_profile: Legacy postprocessing tools for RevBayes output
tools.detailed_description: This is the older version of the RevGadgets R package, used for processing and visualizing RevBayes output.

tools.name: Revticulate
tools.one_line_profile: R interface for interacting with RevBayes
tools.detailed_description: Revticulate is an R library that allows users to call functions and interact with RevBayes directly from the R environment.

tools.name: RevBayes
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian phylogenetic inference using graphical models
tools.detailed_description: RevBayes is a software package for Bayesian phylogenetic inference using graphical models and an interactive model-specification language.

tools.name: revbayes_kernel
tools.one_line_profile: Jupyter kernel for RevBayes
tools.detailed_description: A Jupyter kernel that enables the execution of RevBayes code within Jupyter notebooks, facilitating interactive analysis and documentation.

tools.name: babette
tools.one_line_profile: R package to work with BEAST2
tools.detailed_description: babette is an R package designed to interface with BEAST2, allowing users to set up, run, and analyze BEAST2 phylogenetic analyses from R.

tools.name: beastier
tools.one_line_profile: R package to run BEAST2
tools.detailed_description: beastier is an R package that provides functions to call and run BEAST2 directly from the R environment.

tools.name: beautier
tools.one_line_profile: R package to generate BEAST2 XML parameter files
tools.detailed_description: beautier is an R package that generates BEAST2 XML input files programmatically, mimicking the functionality of the BEAUti GUI.

tools.name: tracerer
tools.one_line_profile: R package to parse and analyze BEAST2 output
tools.detailed_description: tracerer is an R package that parses and analyzes the log and tree files produced by BEAST2, acting as a programmatic alternative to the Tracer software.

tools.name: tidetree
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian phylogenetic framework for single-cell lineage tracing
tools.detailed_description: tidetree is a Bayesian phylogenetic framework designed to estimate single-cell trees and population dynamic parameters from genetic lineage tracing data.

tools.name: pyjar
tools.one_line_profile: Joint ancestral state reconstruction algorithm implementation
tools.detailed_description: pyjar is a Python implementation of the joint ancestral state reconstruction algorithm described by Pupko et al.

tools.name: rapidNJ
tools.one_line_profile: Fast Neighbour-Joining method for phylogenetic inference
tools.detailed_description: rapidNJ is a high-performance implementation of the Neighbour-Joining method, enabling rapid phylogenetic inference on large datasets.

tools.name: Phyling
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic inference from annotated genomes
tools.detailed_description: Phyling is a tool for performing phylogenetic inference directly from annotated genome sequences, automating marker selection and tree building.

tools.name: ExaML
tools.one_line_profile: Exascale Maximum Likelihood code for phylogenetic inference
tools.detailed_description: ExaML is a code for phylogenetic inference using the Maximum Likelihood method, optimized for exascale computing environments using MPI.

tools.name: PhyML
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic estimation using Maximum Likelihood
tools.detailed_description: PhyML is a widely used software package for phylogenetic estimation using the Maximum Likelihood principle, supporting various models of DNA and protein evolution.

tools.name: MBASR
tools.one_line_profile: MrBayes Ancestral States with R
tools.detailed_description: MBASR is an R-based tool designed to facilitate ancestral state reconstruction using MrBayes.

tools.name: aPhyloGeo-pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogeographic workflow using sliding-windows
tools.detailed_description: aPhyloGeo-pipeline is a phylogeographic workflow that utilizes sliding-window analysis, RAxML-NG, and FastTree to investigate genetic variation across geography.

tools.name: get_phylomarkers
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline to select optimal markers for microbial phylogenomics
tools.detailed_description: get_phylomarkers is a pipeline for selecting optimal genetic markers for microbial phylogenomics and species tree estimation, supporting multispecies coalescent and concatenation approaches.

tools.name: phylopipe
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline to build massive trees from global data
tools.detailed_description: phylopipe is a Nextflow pipeline designed to construct massive phylogenetic trees from global viral datasets.

tools.name: diffsel
tools.one_line_profile: Detect convergent evolution using Bayesian phylogenetic codon models
tools.detailed_description: diffsel is a C++ program that uses Bayesian phylogenetic codon models to detect signatures of convergent evolution in sequence data.

tools.name: ChromoSSE
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic models of chromosome evolution
tools.detailed_description: ChromoSSE implements phylogenetic models for studying chromosome number evolution and chromosomal rearrangements.

tools.name: AMPHORA2
tools.one_line_profile: Automated Phylogenomic Inference Pipeline for Bacteria and Archaea
tools.detailed_description: AMPHORA2 is an automated pipeline for phylogenomic inference, specifically designed for analyzing bacterial and archaeal sequences.

tools.name: Phyla_AMPHORA
tools.one_line_profile: Phylum-specific Automated Phylogenomic Inference Pipeline
tools.detailed_description: Phyla_AMPHORA is a specialized version of the AMPHORA pipeline, tailored for phylum-specific phylogenomic inference in bacteria.

tools.name: BactDating
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian inference of ancestral dates on bacterial phylogenetic trees
tools.detailed_description: BactDating is an R package for performing Bayesian inference of ancestral dates and evolutionary rates on bacterial phylogenetic trees.

tools.name: VEHoP
tools.one_line_profile: Versatile Homology-based Phylogenomic pipeline
tools.detailed_description: VEHoP is a versatile and easy-to-use pipeline for homology-based phylogenomic inference, accommodating DNA, RNA, and protein sequences.

tools.name: PhyloInfer
tools.one_line_profile: Library for efficient Bayesian phylogenetic inference methods
tools.detailed_description: PhyloInfer is a Python library focused on developing and implementing efficient methods for Bayesian phylogenetic inference, often using variational inference.

tools.name: sbn
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic Posterior Estimator via subsplit Bayesian networks
tools.detailed_description: This tool implements a method for generalizing phylogenetic posterior estimators from MCMC samples using subsplit Bayesian networks.

tools.name: vbpi-gnn
tools.one_line_profile: Learnable topological features for phylogenetic inference via GNN
tools.detailed_description: vbpi-gnn provides code for learning topological features for phylogenetic inference using Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) within a Variational Bayesian framework.

tools.name: vbpi-nf
tools.one_line_profile: Variational Bayesian phylogenetic inference with normalizing flows
tools.detailed_description: vbpi-nf implements improved Variational Bayesian Phylogenetic Inference (VBPI) using normalizing flows to better approximate posterior distributions.

tools.name: SynNet-Pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for Building Microsynteny Networks
tools.detailed_description: SynNet-Pipeline is a workflow designed for constructing and analyzing microsynteny networks from genomic data.

tools.name: PhyloGFN
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic inference with generative flow networks
tools.detailed_description: PhyloGFN is an implementation of Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets) applied to the problem of phylogenetic inference.

tools.name: GARLI
tools.one_line_profile: Genetic Algorithm for Rapid Likelihood Inference
tools.detailed_description: GARLI is a software package for phylogenetic inference that uses a genetic algorithm to find the maximum likelihood tree.

tools.name: GERP (Modified Pipeline)
tools.one_line_profile: Modified Genomic Evolutionary Rate Profiling pipeline for genetic load analysis
tools.detailed_description: A specialized pipeline based on GERP (Genomic Evolutionary Rate Profiling) adapted for analyzing genetic load in wildlife species, facilitating the identification of constrained genomic elements.

tools.name: CASTOR ETC
tools.one_line_profile: Exposure Time Calculator for the CASTOR telescope mission
tools.detailed_description: A simulation and planning tool designed to calculate exposure times and signal-to-noise ratios for observations with the CASTOR (Cosmological Advanced Survey Telescope for Optical and uv Research) telescope.

tools.name: ratematrix
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian estimation of the evolutionary rate matrix
tools.detailed_description: An R package for the Bayesian estimation of the evolutionary rate matrix (R) for continuous traits, allowing for the study of integration and modularity in an evolutionary context.

tools.name: caper
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for Cromwell/WDL workflow management
tools.detailed_description: A wrapper tool for Cromwell, designed by the ENCODE DCC to simplify the execution of WDL (Workflow Description Language) pipelines for genomic data processing on cloud and HPC environments.

tools.name: BamM
tools.one_line_profile: Metagenomics-focused BAM file manipulation tool
tools.detailed_description: A C-based utility for parsing and manipulating BAM files specifically tailored for metagenomics applications, offering efficient filtering and processing capabilities.

tools.name: Herodotools
tools.one_line_profile: R package for analysis of historical biogeography
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed for the analysis of historical biogeography, providing tools to integrate phylogenetic and geographic data to study species distribution patterns over time.

tools.name: Evodictor
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for predicting evolution by trait gain/loss patterns
tools.detailed_description: A software package for learning evolutionary patterns and predicting future evolutionary events based on the gain and loss of specific traits across lineages.

tools.name: postMCMCglmm
tools.one_line_profile: Post-estimation utilities for MCMCglmm models
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing functions for post-estimation analysis and visualization of results from MCMCglmm (Markov Chain Monte Carlo for Generalized Linear Mixed Models), commonly used in phylogenetic comparative methods.

tools.name: Paddle Graph Learning (PGL)
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient graph learning framework based on PaddlePaddle
tools.detailed_description: A graph learning framework based on PaddlePaddle, widely used in AI for Science applications such as molecular property prediction, protein structure analysis, and other graph-based scientific modeling tasks.

tools.name: motmot
tools.one_line_profile: Functions for fitting models of trait evolution on phylogenies
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing functions for fitting continuous trait evolution models on phylogenies, including tests for variation in rates of evolution and other comparative methods.

tools.name: Beastiary
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time remote monitoring tool for BEAST MCMC analyses
tools.detailed_description: A tool for real-time and remote monitoring of MCMC traces from BEAST (Bayesian Evolutionary Analysis Sampling Trees) software, allowing researchers to inspect convergence and mixing of phylogenetic models via a web interface.

tools.name: shinyTempSignal
tools.one_line_profile: R Shiny app for exploring temporal and phylogenetic signals
tools.detailed_description: An R-based Shiny application designed to explore and visualize temporal signals and other phylogenetic signals in evolutionary data, facilitating the assessment of molecular clock models.

tools.name: adephylo
tools.one_line_profile: Exploratory analyses for phylogenetic comparative methods in R
tools.detailed_description: An R package dedicated to the analysis of comparative data, providing tools for visualizing and analyzing phylogenetic signals, trait evolution, and orthonormal bases on trees within the ade4 ecosystem.

tools.name: ArborWebApps
tools.one_line_profile: Web applications for the Arbor phylogenetic comparative methods workflow
tools.detailed_description: A collection of web-based applications used within the NSF Arbor project to perform various phylogenetic comparative analyses and visualizations.

tools.name: coevol
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian inference of correlated evolution between substitution rates and traits
tools.detailed_description: A software package for reconstructing the correlated evolution of substitution rates and continuous quantitative traits along a phylogenetic tree using a Bayesian framework.

tools.name: Castor
tools.one_line_profile: Spatial simulation model for forest and land management
tools.detailed_description: A decision support tool and spatial simulation model designed for forest and land management planning, allowing researchers and managers to evaluate the impact of various policies on forest ecosystems.

tools.name: CASTOR_KRFE
tools.one_line_profile: Alignment-free identification of discriminant genomic subsequences
tools.detailed_description: An alignment-free method (CASTOR) based on Kernel Density Estimation (KRFE) to identify and analyze discriminant genomic subsequences within pathogen sequences, useful for genomic classification.

tools.name: paleobuddy
tools.one_line_profile: R package for simulating diversification dynamics and fossil records
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides flexible tools for simulating species diversification dynamics, generating fossil records, and constructing phylogenies, bridging the gap between neontological and paleontological data.

tools.name: evorates
tools.one_line_profile: R package for fitting relaxed models of continuous trait evolution
tools.detailed_description: An R package implementing methods for fitting 'relaxed' models of continuous trait evolution to comparative data, allowing the rate of trait evolution to change over time and across lineages.

tools.name: castoRedc
tools.one_line_profile: R wrapper for Castor EDC clinical research platform
tools.detailed_description: An R package that interacts with the Castor EDC (Electronic Data Capture) API, enabling researchers to export, manage, and analyze clinical trial data programmatically.

tools.name: bammix
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to search for nucleotide mixtures in BAM files
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool designed to summarize nucleotide counts at specific positions in BAM files to identify mixed infections or within-host diversity in genomic sequencing data.

tools.name: PyRate
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian estimation of speciation and extinction rates from fossil data
tools.detailed_description: A Python program to estimate speciation, extinction, and preservation rates from fossil occurrence data using a Bayesian framework, widely used in paleobiology and macroevolutionary studies.

tools.name: fossilBM
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian inference of trait evolution under fossilized Brownian motion
tools.detailed_description: An R package for the Bayesian inference of continuous trait evolution on phylogenies that include fossil data, utilizing a 'fossilized' Brownian motion model.

tools.name: PastML
tools.one_line_profile: Ancestral character reconstruction and visualisation tool
tools.detailed_description: PastML provides methods for ancestral character reconstruction (ACR) and visualization on rooted phylogenetic trees, supporting various evolutionary models.

tools.name: phylosignal
tools.one_line_profile: R package for exploring phylogenetic signal in continuous traits
tools.detailed_description: A library to assess and visualize the phylogenetic signal in continuous traits using various statistical methods and evolutionary models.

tools.name: POMS
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic Organization of Metagenomic Signals
tools.detailed_description: A tool for analyzing the phylogenetic organization of metagenomic signals, linking functional traits to phylogeny in microbial communities.

tools.name: BAMM
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian Analysis of Macroevolutionary Mixtures
tools.detailed_description: A program for modeling complex dynamics of speciation, extinction, and trait evolution on phylogenetic trees using Bayesian mixtures.

tools.name: BAMMtools
tools.one_line_profile: R package for analysis and visualization of BAMM results
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing functions for analyzing, interpreting, and visualizing the output from the BAMM software.

tools.name: ES-sim
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation-based test for trait-dependent diversification
tools.detailed_description: A simulation tool to test for correlations between diversification rates and continuous traits, addressing false positives in other methods.

tools.name: delta_statistic
tools.one_line_profile: Calculates the delta statistic for measuring phylogenetic signal of categorical traits
tools.detailed_description: A set of R codes to calculate delta, a phylogenetic analog of Shannon entropy, used to measure the degree of phylogenetic signal between a categorical trait and a phylogeny.

tools.name: arbutus
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for assessing the adequacy of phylogenetic models of quantitative trait evolution
tools.detailed_description: An R package for evaluating how well phylogenetic models of continuous trait evolution fit the data, providing metrics for model adequacy beyond simple likelihood comparisons.

tools.name: geiger-v2
tools.one_line_profile: Suite of methods and models for studying evolutionary radiations and trait evolution
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive R package for fitting macroevolutionary models to phylogenetic trees and comparative data, including methods for analyzing trait evolution (Brownian motion, OU) and diversification rates.

tools.name: TrEvol
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for studying functional trait syndromes and predicting missing trait values
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides a methodological framework to analyze associations between functional traits, phylogenies, and environmental factors, including capabilities for imputing missing trait data.

tools.name: RRphylo
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic comparative method for estimating evolutionary rates
tools.detailed_description: An R package implementing the Ridge Regression Phylogenetic method to estimate evolutionary rates and detect shifts in rates across the tree for continuous traits.

tools.name: Phylogenetics-for-Mathematica
tools.one_line_profile: Mathematica package for phylogenetic analysis and trait simulation
tools.detailed_description: An add-in for Mathematica that performs basic phylogenetic functions such as tree I/O, independent contrasts, ancestral state reconstruction, and simulation of continuous trait evolution.

tools.name: phyloRNN
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning tool for estimating evolutionary rates using RNNs
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool that utilizes Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN) to estimate evolutionary rates from sequence data, representing an AI-driven approach to phylogenetics.

tools.name: btw
tools.one_line_profile: R wrapper for the BayesTraits software
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides a wrapper for BayesTraits, enabling users to run BayesTraits analyses on trait evolution and ancestral state reconstruction directly from R.

tools.name: RASP
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for reconstructing ancestral states in phylogenies
tools.detailed_description: Reconstruct Ancestral State in Phylogenies (RASP) is a tool for inferring ancestral states (biogeography or traits) using various methods like S-DIVA, DEC, and Bayes-LAGRANGE.

tools.name: NELSI
tools.one_line_profile: Nucleotide Evolutionary rate Simulator
tools.detailed_description: A tool for simulating nucleotide sequences with variable evolutionary rates, useful for testing molecular clock models and phylogenetic methods.

tools.name: PhyloTools.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia package for phylogenetic analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library providing tools for phylogenetic analysis, inspired by R packages like ape and phytools, offering functionality for tree manipulation and comparative methods.

tools.name: BaMMmotif
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian Markov Model motif discovery tool
tools.detailed_description: An expectation maximization algorithm for the de novo discovery of enriched motifs in nucleotide sequences using higher-order Bayesian Markov models.

tools.name: BaMMmotif2
tools.one_line_profile: Improved Bayesian Markov Model motif discovery tool (Version 2)
tools.detailed_description: The second version of the BaMMmotif tool, providing enhanced performance and features for de novo motif discovery using higher-order Markov models.

tools.name: OUwie
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis of continuous character evolution under Ornstein-Uhlenbeck models
tools.detailed_description: A package that estimates and compares rate differences of continuous character evolution under Brownian motion and various Ornstein-Uhlenbeck (OU) models, allowing selection strength and drift to vary across regimes.

tools.name: HiSSE
tools.one_line_profile: Hidden State Speciation and Extinction model implementation
tools.detailed_description: An R package for estimating Hidden State Speciation and Extinction (HiSSE) models to test for trait-dependent diversification while accounting for hidden factors.

tools.name: plant
tools.one_line_profile: Trait-driven individual-based models of ecology and evolution
tools.detailed_description: A package for simulating the growth of individual plants and the evolution of plant functional traits within a competitive environment.

tools.name: rphenoscate
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic trait evolution analysis with phenotypic ontologies
tools.detailed_description: Tools for analyzing trait evolution on phylogenetic trees, specifically integrating phenotypic ontologies to handle complex trait data.

tools.name: CASTOR
tools.one_line_profile: Cardiac Segmentation with Constraints
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning based tool for cardiac image segmentation that incorporates shape constraints to improve accuracy.

tools.name: D-Persona
tools.one_line_profile: Diversified and Personalized Multi-rater Medical Image Segmentation
tools.detailed_description: Official implementation of D-Persona, a method for handling multi-rater ambiguity in medical image segmentation tasks.

tools.name: SPRINTER
tools.one_line_profile: Single-cell Proliferation Rate Inference in Tumours
tools.detailed_description: A tool to infer proliferation rates in non-homogeneous tumours using evolutionary routes from single-cell data.

tools.name: PhyloFisher
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenomic dataset creation, analysis, and visualization package
tools.detailed_description: PhyloFisher is a software package for the creation, analysis, and visualization of phylogenomic datasets consisting of eukaryotic protein sequences. It handles the entire workflow from manual curation of orthologs to matrix construction and tree visualization.

tools.name: itol.toolkit
tools.one_line_profile: Helper functions for Interactive Tree Of Life (iTOL) annotation
tools.detailed_description: itol.toolkit is an R package designed to support the Interactive Tree Of Life (iTOL) workflow. It provides helper functions to generate, parse, and export annotation files and datasets compatible with iTOL's visualization features.

tools.name: DoubleRecViz
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization tool for double reconciliations of phylogenetic trees
tools.detailed_description: DoubleRecViz is a tool for visualizing and editing double reconciliations between phylogenetic trees at three levels: transcript, gene, and species. It aids in understanding complex evolutionary events involving gene duplication and loss.

tools.name: ggtree
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization and annotation of phylogenetic trees using ggplot2
tools.detailed_description: ggtree is an R package that extends ggplot2 for visualizing and annotating phylogenetic trees with their covariates and other associated data. It supports parsing various tree file formats and provides a programmable interface for tree visualization.

tools.name: ggtreeDendro
tools.one_line_profile: Dendrogram visualization extension for ggtree
tools.detailed_description: ggtreeDendro is an extension of ggtree specifically designed for drawing dendrograms. It allows users to visualize hierarchical clustering results using the ggtree grammar.

tools.name: ggtreeExtra
tools.one_line_profile: Extensions for adding geom layers to ggtree visualizations
tools.detailed_description: ggtreeExtra provides additional functions to add geometric layers to circular or other layout trees generated by ggtree. It facilitates the visualization of complex data associated with tree tips or nodes.

tools.name: ggtreeSpace
tools.one_line_profile: Phylomorphospace exploration using ggtree
tools.detailed_description: ggtreeSpace is a tool for exploring phylomorphospace, allowing researchers to visualize the evolution of morphological traits within a phylogenetic context using the ggtree framework.

tools.name: iggtree
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive phylogenetic tree visualization
tools.detailed_description: iggtree combines ggtree with ggiraph to provide interactive capabilities for phylogenetic tree visualizations, allowing users to hover, click, and explore tree data dynamically.

tools.name: iggtree-shiny
tools.one_line_profile: Shiny application for interactive ggtree visualization
tools.detailed_description: iggtree-shiny is a Shiny-based web application that provides a graphical user interface for visualizing and interacting with phylogenetic trees using ggtree.

tools.name: ggalign
tools.one_line_profile: Composable visualization framework for biological alignments
tools.detailed_description: ggalign is a ggplot2-based visualization framework often used in bioinformatics to create complex, aligned plots such as heatmaps and multiple sequence alignments, integrating closely with the ggtree ecosystem.

tools.name: itolapi
tools.one_line_profile: Python API for automating iTOL interactions
tools.detailed_description: itolapi is a Python library that provides an interface to the Interactive Tree of Life (iTOL) web service, enabling automated uploading, exporting, and management of phylogenetic trees and datasets.

tools.name: TreeViewer
tools.one_line_profile: Cross-platform phylogenetic tree drawing software
tools.detailed_description: TreeViewer is a standalone, cross-platform software application designed for drawing and visualizing phylogenetic trees with a focus on producing publication-quality figures.

tools.name: empress
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable phylogenetic tree viewer for microbiome data
tools.detailed_description: Empress is a fast and scalable phylogenetic tree viewer specifically designed for microbiome data analysis. It integrates with QIIME 2 and allows for the exploration of large trees alongside feature metadata and taxonomy.

tools.name: archaeopteryx-js
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based visualization and analysis of annotated phylogenetic trees
tools.detailed_description: Archaeopteryx.js is a software tool for the visualization and analysis of highly annotated phylogenetic trees. It is the JavaScript successor to the Java-based Archaeopteryx, enabling web-based exploration of evolutionary data.

tools.name: forester
tools.one_line_profile: Libraries for phylogenomics and evolutionary biology research
tools.detailed_description: Forester is a collection of open-source libraries (Java and Ruby) for phylogenomics and evolutionary biology research. It serves as the foundation for tools like Archaeopteryx and provides utilities for tree manipulation and analysis.

tools.name: TreeProfiler
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic tree visualization tool integrating annotation data
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed for visualizing phylogenetic trees combined with complex annotation data, allowing researchers to map metadata onto tree structures for comparative genomic analysis.

tools.name: Exelixis
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based interactive phylogenetic tree viewer
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, interactive web-based viewer for phylogenetic trees, designed to provide easy access to tree visualization without complex installation.

tools.name: deeptools_intervals
tools.one_line_profile: Interval tree library for genomic annotations
tools.detailed_description: A Python C-extension library used by deepTools for efficiently constructing and querying interval trees associated with genomic exon/annotation information.

tools.name: paleotree
tools.one_line_profile: Paleontological and phylogenetic analysis library
tools.detailed_description: An R library for analyzing, time-scaling, and simulating phylogenies of extinct/fossil lineages, including plotting diversity curves and handling stratigraphic range data.

tools.name: toytree
tools.one_line_profile: Minimalist phylogenetic tree plotting library
tools.detailed_description: A Python library based on toyplot for constructing, manipulating, and visualizing phylogenetic trees with a focus on clean, minimalist aesthetics suitable for publication.

tools.name: baltic
tools.one_line_profile: Library for molecular phylogeny manipulation and visualisation
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Python library designed for the import, manipulation, analysis, and visualization of phylogenetic trees and associated molecular data.

tools.name: gotree
tools.one_line_profile: Command line tools and API for phylogenetic tree manipulation
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive toolkit and Go library for manipulating phylogenetic trees, offering functionalities for filtering, pruning, re-rooting, and comparing trees via CLI.

tools.name: PanACoTA
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for large-scale comparative genomics
tools.detailed_description: A software pipeline for massive comparative genomics projects, handling genome annotation, core/pan-genome identification, sequence alignment, and phylogenetic tree reconstruction.

tools.name: Dendroscope3
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive viewer for rooted phylogenetic trees and networks
tools.detailed_description: A Java-based application for visualizing, analyzing, and comparing rooted phylogenetic trees and networks, suitable for handling large datasets.

tools.name: iTOL API
tools.one_line_profile: Python API and CLI for Interactive Tree Of Life
tools.detailed_description: A Python library and command-line interface for interacting with the iTOL (Interactive Tree Of Life) web service, enabling automated upload and management of phylogenetic trees.

tools.name: plottree
tools.one_line_profile: CLI tool for quick phylogenetic tree visualization
tools.detailed_description: A simple command-line tool for quickly visualizing phylogenetic trees directly from the terminal, supporting various formats and basic layout adjustments.

tools.name: phyloshapeR
tools.one_line_profile: R package for plotting phylogenetic trees with custom shapes
tools.detailed_description: A package to plot phylogenies with custom shapes, allowing for enhanced visualization of evolutionary relationships.

tools.name: DendroPy
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for phylogenetic computing
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for phylogenetic scripting, simulation, data processing, and manipulation. It supports reading and writing multiple phylogenetic data formats and performing various tree operations.

tools.name: microbiomeViz
tools.one_line_profile: Visualizing microbiome data with ggtree
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed to visualize microbiome data, leveraging the capabilities of ggtree for generating complex phylogenetic visualizations.

tools.name: jstreeview
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive phylogenetic tree viewer and editor
tools.detailed_description: A web-based interactive viewer and editor for phylogenetic trees, allowing users to visualize and manipulate tree structures directly in the browser.

tools.name: anvi'o
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis and visualization platform for 'omics data
tools.detailed_description: An advanced analysis and visualization platform for 'omics data, supporting metagenomics, pangenomics, and phylogenomics workflows with integrated tree visualization capabilities.

tools.name: table2itol
tools.one_line_profile: Generate iTOL annotations from spreadsheets
tools.detailed_description: A utility to convert spreadsheet or CSV data into annotation files compatible with the Interactive Tree Of Life (iTOL) visualization tool.

tools.name: Iroki
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic customization and visualization of phylogenetic trees
tools.detailed_description: A web-based tool for the visualization and automatic customization of phylogenetic trees using simple text files to control formatting.

tools.name: ANIclustermap
tools.one_line_profile: Draw ANI clustermap for microbial genomes
tools.detailed_description: A tool for calculating Average Nucleotide Identity (ANI) and generating clustermaps and phylogenetic trees to visualize relationships between microbial genomes.

tools.name: phyTreeViz
tools.one_line_profile: Simple phylogenetic tree visualization package
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for visualizing phylogenetic trees, designed to be simple and easy to integrate into phylogenetic analysis workflows.

tools.name: phyloTree
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive phylogenetic tree viewer component
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for interactive phylogenetic tree visualization, developed as part of the Nextstrain ecosystem.

tools.name: treeanno
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based tool for syntactic tree annotation
tools.detailed_description: A tool for annotating tree structures, primarily used for syntactic annotation in computational linguistics.

tools.name: shiptv
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive phylogenetic tree visualization
tools.detailed_description: A standalone HTML tool for interactive phylogenetic tree visualization, powered by Phylocanvas.

tools.name: Topiary-Explorer
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive phylogenetic tree viewing software
tools.detailed_description: A Java-based application for interactive visualization of phylogenetic trees, associated with the QIIME pipeline.

tools.name: FigTree
tools.one_line_profile: Graphical viewer of phylogenetic trees
tools.detailed_description: A graphical viewer of phylogenetic trees and a program for producing publication-ready figures. It is designed to display summarized trees produced by BEAST or MrBayes.

tools.name: figtree.js
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript library for displaying phylogenetic trees
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for rendering phylogenetic trees in the browser, derived from the logic of the desktop FigTree application.

tools.name: fheatmap
tools.one_line_profile: R function for plotting heatmaps with phylogenetic dendrograms
tools.detailed_description: An R package to plot high-quality heatmaps using ggplot2 graphics, featuring coloring of row/column side trees (dendrograms) and extensive annotation capabilities.

tools.name: Empress (Cophylogeny)
tools.one_line_profile: Systematic Cophylogeny Reconciliation Tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for systematic cophylogeny reconciliation under the Duplication-Transfer-Loss (DTL) model, used to study host-parasite co-evolution.

tools.name: microreact_integration
tools.one_line_profile: Integration library for Microreact genomic epidemiology visualization
tools.detailed_description: Python code for integrating with Microreact, a tool for open data visualization and sharing for genomic epidemiology (trees and maps). Developed by SSI.

tools.name: tree-subset-shiny
tools.one_line_profile: Shiny app for visualizing subsets of phylogenetic trees
tools.detailed_description: A Shiny application that allows users to visualize and interact with subsets of large phylogenetic trees.

tools.name: IcyTree
tools.one_line_profile: Browser-based phylogenetic tree visualization
tools.detailed_description: A browser-based utility for phylogenetic tree visualization, supporting various tree formats and annotations.

tools.name: TNT (Trees and Tracks)
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization of trees and track-based annotations
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for visualizing phylogenetic trees and track-based genomic annotations, developed at EMBL-EBI.

tools.name: phylotree.js
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive viewer of phylogenetic trees
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for developing interactive phylogenetic tree visualizations, widely used in web-based bioinformatics tools.

tools.name: phyd3
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic tree viewer based on D3.js
tools.detailed_description: A phylogenetic tree visualization library built on top of D3.js, designed for interactivity and web integration.

tools.name: FIGTree (Fast Improved Gauss Transform)
tools.one_line_profile: Fast computation of Gauss transforms and Kernel Density Estimation
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library for the Fast Improved Gauss Transform (FIGTree), enabling efficient Kernel Density Estimation (KDE) in multiple dimensions. (Note: Homonym to the phylogenetic viewer, but a valid scientific math/stats tool).

tools.name: treesiftr
tools.one_line_profile: Package to visualize trees and phylogenetic data
tools.detailed_description: An R package for visualizing phylogenetic trees and associated data, developed for educational and research purposes.

tools.name: phytop
tools.one_line_profile: Visualizing species tree from ASTRAL with gene tree discordance
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for visualizing species trees inferred by ASTRAL, highlighting gene tree discordance and support values.

tools.name: NestedBD
tools.one_line_profile: BEAST 2 package for Nested Birth-Death models in phylodynamics
tools.detailed_description: A package for the BEAST 2 platform that implements Nested Birth-Death models, allowing for the inference of hierarchical population dynamics from phylogenetic trees.

tools.name: GToTree
tools.one_line_profile: User-friendly workflow for phylogenomics from genomes to trees
tools.detailed_description: A workflow that automates the process of generating phylogenomic trees from a set of genomes. It handles gene search, alignment, concatenation, and tree inference.

tools.name: bModelTest
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian model test package for BEAST 2
tools.detailed_description: A BEAST 2 package that performs Bayesian model averaging over site models, allowing for simultaneous inference of the substitution model and the phylogeny.

tools.name: substmodels
tools.one_line_profile: Standard substitution models for BEAST 2
tools.detailed_description: A package containing standard nucleotide and amino acid substitution models for use with the BEAST 2 phylogenetic software.

tools.name: PHACT
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogeny workflow for batch submission to HPC clusters
tools.detailed_description: A workflow designed for submitting batch phylogeny tasks to HPC clusters using the Slurm queue manager, facilitating large-scale phylogenetic analyses.

tools.name: EvoX
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed GPU-Accelerated Framework for Evolutionary Computation
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library and framework for evolutionary algorithms and benchmark problems, leveraging JAX for GPU acceleration and distributed computing. Useful for scientific optimization problems.

tools.name: phyx
tools.one_line_profile: Command-line tools for phylogenetic data analysis
tools.detailed_description: A collection of command-line tools for performing various operations on phylogenetic trees and sequence alignments, such as conversion, filtering, and analysis.

tools.name: contacTrees
tools.one_line_profile: BEAST 2 package for inferring ancestral conversion graphs
tools.detailed_description: A BEAST 2 package designed for language phylogenetics, specifically for inferring ancestral conversion graphs to model contact and borrowing between languages.

tools.name: PhyloM
tools.one_line_profile: Tumor Phylogeny Topology Inference via Deep Learning
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning-based tool for inferring the topology of tumor phylogenies, applying phylogenetic methods to cancer evolution.

tools.name: PhyloBayes
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian phylogenetic reconstruction using infinite mixtures
tools.detailed_description: A Bayesian Monte Carlo Markov Chain (MCMC) sampler for phylogenetic reconstruction using protein or nucleic acid alignments. It implements non-parametric methods (CAT and CAT-GTR models) for modeling site-specific evolutionary processes.

tools.name: PhyloPhlAn
tools.one_line_profile: Precise phylogenetic analysis of microbial isolates and metagenomes
tools.detailed_description: An integrated pipeline for large-scale phylogenetic profiling of genomes and metagenomes. It uses identifying markers to reconstruct high-resolution phylogenies for microbial isolates.

tools.name: EMPress
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and scalable phylogenetic tree viewer
tools.detailed_description: A web-based phylogenetic tree viewer designed to handle large trees (hundreds of thousands of tips) and integrate with microbiome data analysis platforms like QIIME 2.

tools.name: Delphy
tools.one_line_profile: Fast, scalable, accurate and accessible Bayesian phylogenetics
tools.detailed_description: A software package for Bayesian phylogenetic inference, designed to be fast and scalable, utilizing modern algorithmic approaches for estimating evolutionary trees.

tools.name: A-pro
tools.one_line_profile: ASTRAL for PaRalogs and Orthologs
tools.detailed_description: An extension of the ASTRAL method designed to handle both paralogs and orthologs for species tree estimation, improving accuracy in the presence of gene duplication and loss.

tools.name: ASTER
tools.one_line_profile: Accurate Species Tree EstimatoR family of algorithms
tools.detailed_description: A suite of optimization algorithms for species tree inference, including fast and scalable implementations like ASTRAL-Pro 3 and CASTER, designed for large-scale phylogenomics.

tools.name: cogent3
tools.one_line_profile: Comparative Genomics Toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library for genomic sequence analysis and comparative genomics, providing tools for controlling process calculators, manipulating sequences, and performing phylogenetic analyses.

tools.name: SNPPar
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel and Homoplasic SNP Finder
tools.detailed_description: A tool for finding homoplasic SNPs and performing parallel evolution analysis from phylogenetic trees and alignment data.

tools.name: PhyloSuite
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated platform for molecular sequence data management and phylogenetics
tools.detailed_description: A desktop platform that integrates various bioinformatics tools to streamline the workflow of molecular sequence data management, alignment, and evolutionary phylogenetic studies.

tools.name: treedater
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable relaxed clock phylogenetic dating
tools.detailed_description: An R package for estimating molecular clock dates on phylogenetic trees, supporting relaxed clock models and scalable to large viral phylogenies.

tools.name: trisicell
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable tumor phylogeny inference from single-cell data
tools.detailed_description: A computational toolkit for scalable inference and validation of tumor phylogenies using single-cell RNA or DNA sequencing data.

tools.name: POTION
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for positive Darwinian selection detection
tools.detailed_description: An end-to-end pipeline for detecting positive Darwinian selection in genome-scale data by performing phylogenetic comparison of protein-coding genes.

tools.name: CAFE5
tools.one_line_profile: Computational Analysis of gene Family Evolution (version 5)
tools.detailed_description: Software for the statistical analysis of the evolution of the size of gene families. It uses a birth and death process to model gene gain and loss across a phylogenetic tree.

tools.name: trimAl
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for automated alignment trimming in phylogenetic analyses
tools.detailed_description: A tool for the automated removal of spurious sequences or poorly aligned regions from a multiple sequence alignment, improving the quality of subsequent phylogenetic reconstruction.

tools.name: teiphy
tools.one_line_profile: Converter for TEI XML collations to phylogenetic formats
tools.detailed_description: A tool for converting textual collation data (in TEI XML format) into formats suitable for phylogenetic analysis (NEXUS, BEAST XML), enabling the application of phylogenetic methods to stemmatology and textual criticism.

tools.name: Orthoscope
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic web tool for phylogenetic inference of orthogroups
tools.detailed_description: A web-based tool designed for the automatic phylogenetic inference of animal and plant orthogroups, facilitating targeted taxonomic sampling and evolutionary analysis.

tools.name: Evolutionary-Rates-Analysis-Pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for large scale phylogenetics comparisons using BOLD data
tools.detailed_description: R-based software pipelines to perform large scale phylogenetics comparisons of various taxa found on the Barcode of Life Database (BOLD) API.

tools.name: TREE-QMC
tools.one_line_profile: Quartet-based species tree estimation algorithm
tools.detailed_description: A scalable algorithm for estimating species trees and trees of blobs from gene trees using quartet-based methods, suitable for handling gene tree discordance.

tools.name: FastTree
tools.one_line_profile: Approximately-maximum-likelihood phylogenetic trees for large alignments
tools.detailed_description: FastTree infers approximately-maximum-likelihood phylogenetic trees from alignments of nucleotide or protein sequences. It handles very large alignments (up to a million sequences) efficiently.

tools.name: SYNPHONI
tools.one_line_profile: Reconstruction of dynamic evolution of syntenic relationships
tools.detailed_description: A tool for reconstructing the dynamic evolution of syntenic relationships across phylogenetic distances, providing syntenic complements for ancestral nodes.

tools.name: SNVPhyl Galaxy
tools.one_line_profile: Whole genome phylogenomics pipeline (Galaxy wrapper)
tools.detailed_description: The Galaxy wrapper and workflow for the SNVPhyl pipeline, which performs whole genome phylogenomics analysis from raw reads to phylogenetic trees.

tools.name: SNVPhyl Tools
tools.one_line_profile: Helper tools for SNVPhyl phylogenomics pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A collection of scripts and tools used within the SNVPhyl pipeline for tasks such as filtering, alignment processing, and file manipulation.

tools.name: EPA-ng
tools.one_line_profile: Massively parallel phylogenetic placement
tools.detailed_description: EPA-ng is a tool for massively parallel phylogenetic placement of genetic sequences, optimized for high performance on modern hardware.

tools.name: THD
tools.one_line_profile: Time-scaled haplotypic density estimation
tools.detailed_description: An R implementation for Time-scaled Haplotypic Density (THD), used to estimate epidemic success and transmission dynamics from pathogen genetic data.

tools.name: speedemon
tools.one_line_profile: BEAST 2 package for species delimitation
tools.detailed_description: A BEAST 2 package designed for rapid species delimitation using genomic data.

tools.name: astral (Python)
tools.one_line_profile: Calculations for the position of the sun and moon
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for calculating the position of the sun and moon, as well as sunrise, sunset, and other solar phases, widely used in astronomical and environmental research.

tools.name: Extract_Consensus_Sequences_of_Genes_from_BAM_parallel
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts for consensus sequence extraction and tree construction
tools.detailed_description: A set of scripts for the rapid construction of target interval consensus sequences from BAM files and subsequent phylogenetic tree construction and visualization.

tools.name: astral (Go)
tools.one_line_profile: Go calculations for the position of the sun and moon
tools.detailed_description: A Go port of the python astral library, providing calculations for the position of the sun and moon.

tools.name: phylotoast
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for phylogenetic data analysis and visualization
tools.detailed_description: A collection of tools for phylogenetic data analysis, including visualization utilities and support for cluster computing, often used with QIIME.

tools.name: ASTRAL
tools.one_line_profile: Accurate Species Tree Algorithm for large datasets
tools.detailed_description: ASTRAL is a tool for estimating a species tree from a set of unrooted gene trees. It is statistically consistent under the multi-species coalescent model and efficient for large datasets.

tools.name: CherryML
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable maximum likelihood estimation of phylogenetic models
tools.detailed_description: CherryML provides scalable maximum likelihood estimation for phylogenetic models, enabling efficient analysis of large-scale evolutionary data.

tools.name: ALE
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic reconciliation of gene trees and species trees using Amalgamated Likelihood Estimation
tools.detailed_description: ALE (Amalgamated Likelihood Estimation) is a probabilistic approach to exhaustively explore all reconciled gene trees that can be amalgamated as a combination of clades observed in a sample of gene trees. It implements a reconciliation model allowing for duplication, transfer, and loss (DTL) of genes to estimate joint likelihoods and infer reconciled gene trees.

tools.name: unicore
tools.one_line_profile: Structure-based core gene phylogeny inference tool
tools.detailed_description: Unicore is a tool for generating universal and efficient structure-based core gene phylogenies. It leverages Foldseek and ProstT5 to utilize protein structure information for phylogenetic inference, offering an alternative to sequence-based methods for deep evolutionary relationships.

tools.name: BDMM-Prime
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-type birth-death-sampling modelling package for BEAST 2
tools.detailed_description: BDMM-Prime is a package for the BEAST 2 phylogenetic software platform that implements multi-type birth-death-sampling models, allowing for the inference of population dynamics and structure from phylogenetic trees.

tools.name: MultiTypeTree
tools.one_line_profile: BEAST 2 package for structured population phylogenetics
tools.detailed_description: MultiTypeTree is a BEAST 2 package that provides support for inferring phylogenetic trees on structured populations (multi-type trees), enabling the analysis of migration and population structure alongside phylogeny.

tools.name: bacter
tools.one_line_profile: Bacterial phylogenetics package for BEAST 2
tools.detailed_description: Bacter is a BEAST 2 package specifically designed for bacterial phylogenetics, addressing the specific evolutionary models and challenges associated with bacterial genomic data inference.

tools.name: feast
tools.one_line_profile: Utility collection for BEAST 2 phylogenetic analysis
tools.detailed_description: Feast provides a collection of miscellaneous tools and model components for the BEAST 2 phylogenetic software, enhancing its capabilities for various evolutionary analyses.

tools.name: remaster
tools.one_line_profile: High-fidelity stochastic tree simulation for BEAST 2
tools.detailed_description: Remaster is a BEAST 2 package for performing high-fidelity stochastic simulations of phylogenetic trees, useful for validating models and generating synthetic data for evolutionary studies.

tools.name: conifer
tools.one_line_profile: FPGA-accelerated Boosted Decision Tree inference for physics
tools.detailed_description: Conifer is a library for fast inference of Boosted Decision Trees (BDTs) on FPGAs, primarily used in High Energy Physics (HEP) for trigger systems and real-time data analysis.

tools.name: tskit
tools.one_line_profile: Population-scale Ancestral Recombination Graph (ARG) library
tools.detailed_description: tskit is a library for defining, storing, and processing large-scale genetic genealogies (tree sequences). It provides efficient methods for population genetics simulations and analysis of Ancestral Recombination Graphs (ARGs).

tools.name: macroTraits
tools.one_line_profile: R functions for macroecological and phylogenetic trait analysis
tools.detailed_description: macroTraits is a set of R functions to test trait correlations, phylogenetic constraints, and spatial variability at large scales, facilitating macroecological and evolutionary research.

tools.name: sitePath
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic pathway-dependent mutation analysis
tools.detailed_description: sitePath is an R package for phylogenetic pathway-dependent recognition of fixed substitutions and parallel mutations. It helps in analyzing molecular evolution by tracing site-specific changes across phylogenetic trees.

tools.name: buscophylo
tools.one_line_profile: Genome-scale phylogenetic analysis workflow
tools.detailed_description: buscophylo is a custom workflow designed for conducting genome-scale phylogenetic analysis, likely integrating BUSCO results for tree reconstruction.

tools.name: TREE
tools.one_line_profile: Interpretable identification of cancer genes via transformer-powered graph learning
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning framework utilizing transformers and graph representation learning to identify cancer genes across biological networks in an interpretable manner.

tools.name: BioNeuralNet
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for analyzing biological data via graph construction and embedding
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed for analyzing biological data by constructing graphs, clustering, and generating embeddings to power downstream tasks like disease prediction and biomarker discovery.

tools.name: Nbed
tools.one_line_profile: Quantum simulation qubit reduction via DFT embedding
tools.detailed_description: A Python package to reduce the qubit requirements of quantum simulation by embedding the problem into Density Functional Theory (DFT) calculations.

tools.name: Ouroboros
tools.one_line_profile: Directed chemical evolution model for molecular encoding in drug discovery
tools.detailed_description: A foundational model bridging representation learning and generative AI to perform directed chemical evolution via navigating molecular encoding space for drug discovery.

tools.name: PhyloDeep
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning library for phylogenetic parameter estimation and model selection
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for parameter estimation and model selection from phylogenetic trees using deep learning techniques.

tools.name: Phyloformer
tools.one_line_profile: Fast phylogeny estimation using self-attention networks
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning tool utilizing self-attention networks (transformers) for fast and accurate phylogenetic tree estimation.

tools.name: DiffEvolTreeSearch
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable phylogenetic tree construction without prior training data
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable approach to phylogenetic tree construction that optimizes tree and ancestral sequences in their original representation, requiring no prior training data.

tools.name: Chronumental
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for estimating time trees from large phylogenies
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to estimate time trees from very large phylogenies, enabling scalable phylogenetic dating.
